pull.title: FreeBSD: Document Python 3 requirement for 'gmake check'
pull.body: `doc/build-freebsd.md` doesn't mention that Python 3 is required to run the test suite. Currently, `gmake check` fails without it.

events.message: FreeBSD: Document Python 3 requirement for 'gmake check'

events.body:
Makes sense.
For the sake of documentation simplicity I would be ok with mentioning python3 as simply one of the dependencies and not just for the tests. I think we do that for other platforms.

@laanwj thanks for your input. I fully agree with you in general. For FreeBSD in particular, I think a sysadmin can decide whether installing Python 3 is worthwhile, rather than just adding another dependency. That was my thought process.
